TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi beforefieldinit XmlChoiceIdentifierAttribute extends System.Attribute

Docs.summary: Specifies that the member can be further detected by using an enumeration.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig specialname rtspecialname instance void .ctor() cil managed

Docs.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

remarks.format:
## Examples The following example serializes a class named `Choices` that includes two fields, `MyChoice` and `ManyChoices`. The <xref:System.Xml.Serialization.XmlChoiceIdentifierAttribute> is applied to each field that specifies (through the <xref:System.Xml.Serialization.XmlChoiceIdentifierAttribute.MemberName%2A> property) another class member that gets or sets an enumeration that detects the member value. The `MyChoice` field can be set to a single value, with a corresponding enumeration member found in the `EnumType` field. The `ManyChoices` field returns an array of objects. The `ChoiceArray` field returns an array of enumeration values. For each array member in the `ManyChoices` field, a corresponding member is found in the array returned by the `ChoiceArray` field.
[!code-cpp[XmlChoiceIdentifierAttribute Example#1](~/samples/snippets/cpp/VS_Snippets_Remoting/XmlChoiceIdentifierAttribute Example/CPP/choice.cpp#1)] [!code-csharp[XmlChoiceIdentifierAttribute Example#1](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_Remoting/XmlChoiceIdentifierAttribute Example/CS/choice.cs#1)] [!code-vb[XmlChoiceIdentifierAttribute Example#1](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_Remoting/XmlChoiceIdentifierAttribute Example/VB/choice.vb#1)]

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig specialname rtspecialname instance void .ctor(string name) cil managed

Docs.param: The member name that returns the enumeration used to detect a choice.
Docs.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.
Gets or sets the name of the field that returns the enumeration to use when detecting types.
Docs.value: The name of a field that returns an enumeration.

remarks.format:
## Remarks At least one member must be present in the enumeration returned by the field named in the <xref:System.Xml.Serialization.XmlChoiceIdentifierAttribute.MemberName%2A> value. By default, that enumeration name takes the name of the field that the <xref:System.Xml.Serialization.XmlChoiceIdentifierAttribute> is applied to.
## Examples The following example serializes a class named `Choices` that includes two fields, `MyChoice` and `ManyChoices`. The <xref:System.Xml.Serialization.XmlChoiceIdentifierAttribute> is applied to each field that specifies (through the <xref:System.Xml.Serialization.XmlChoiceIdentifierAttribute.MemberName%2A> property) another class member that gets or sets an enumeration that detects the member value. The `MyChoice` field can be set to a single value, with a corresponding enumeration member found in the `EnumType` field. The `ManyChoices` field returns an array of objects. The `ChoiceArray` field returns an array of enumeration values. For each array member in the `ManyChoices` field, a corresponding member is found in the array returned by the `ChoiceArray` field.
[!code-cpp[XmlChoiceIdentifierAttribute Example#1](~/samples/snippets/cpp/VS_Snippets_Remoting/XmlChoiceIdentifierAttribute Example/CPP/choice.cpp#1)] [!code-csharp[XmlChoiceIdentifierAttribute Example#1](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_Remoting/XmlChoiceIdentifierAttribute Example/CS/choice.cs#1)] [!code-vb[XmlChoiceIdentifierAttribute Example#1](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_Remoting/XmlChoiceIdentifierAttribute Example/VB/choice.vb#1)]
